title: DEINO
content:
DEINO was the Naiad-nymphs of the springs of the river Sperkheios (Spercheus) in Malis, central Greece. She was
        the wife of the god of the river.

Deino was probably an Okeanid-nymph like most of the other river-wives.

THE SPERKHEIDES, DIOPATRE (by Sperkheios) (Antoninus Liberalis
          22)

Antoninus Liberalis, Metamorphoses 22 (trans. Celoria) (Greek mythographer C2nd A.D.)
          :
        "[The shepherd Kerambos (Cerambus) claimed that] the Nymphai (Nymphs) [of Mount Othrys], were not descended
        from Zeus, but that Deino had given birth to them, with the River Sperkheios (Spercheus) was the father. He also
        said that Poseidon, for lust of one of them, Diopatre (Diopatra), had made her sisters put down roots and turned
        them into poplars until, satiated with his desires, he had returned them to their original shapes."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
